title: Infosys 2Q Net Slips, But Still Beats Expectations
text:
By Saurabh Chaturvedi

Infosys Ltd. (500209.BY) reported a 2.2% on-year fall in its fiscal second-quarter net profit, though the decline was shallower than expected.

Net profit for the July-to-September quarter was 40.19 billion rupees ($566.1 million), compared with INR41.10 billion in the same period a year earlier, the Indian software and information-technology services company said Friday. Analysts polled by S&P Global Market Intelligence expected net profit of INR40.16 billion.

Revenue rose to INR226.29 billion from INR206.09 billion, it said. Analysts had expected the company's revenue at INR224.98 billion.

The company said it now expects revenue to grow between 9% and 10% in the current fiscal year ending March 31, from its earlier estimate of 8.5%-10%.
